summary.para: Adds a source element to the end of the list.

param.name: pURL
param.para: The URL of the source element, or NULL.

param.name: pType
param.para: The MIME type of the source element, or NULL.

param.name: pMedia
param.para: A media-query string that specifies the intended media type, or NULL. If specified, the string should conform to the W3C Media Queries specification.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Any of the parameters to this method can be NULL.
This method allocates copies of the BSTRs that are passed in.

summary.para: Gets the number of source elements in the list.

returns.para: Returns the number of source elements.

summary.para: Gets the intended media type of an element in the list.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the source element. To get the number of source elements, call .

param.name: pMedia
param.para: Receives a BSTR that contains a media-query string. The caller must free the BSTR by calling SysFreeString. If no media type is set, this parameter receives the value NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The string returned in pMedia should be a media-query string that conforms to the W3C Media Queries specification.

summary.para: Gets the MIME type of an element in the list.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the source element. To get the number of source elements, call .

param.name: pType
param.para: Receives a BSTR that contains the MIME type. The caller must free the BSTR by calling SysFreeString. If no MIME type is set, this parameter receives the value NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the URL of an element in the list.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the source element. To get the number of source elements, call .

param.name: pURL
param.para: Receives a BSTR that contains the URL of the source element. The caller must free the BSTR by calling SysFreeString. If no URL is set, this parameter receives the value NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Removes all of the source elements from the list.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Provides the Media Engine with a list of media resources.

remarks.para: The IMFMediaEngineSrcElements interface represents an ordered list of media resources.

This interface enables the application to provide the same audio/video content in several different encoding formats, such as H.264 and Windows Media Video. If a particular codec is not present on the user's computer, the Media Engine will try the next URL in the list. To use this interface, do the following:

item.description: Create an implementation of this interface.
Initialize your implementation with a list of URLs. Optionally, provide MIME types and media query strings for each URL.
